abstract: New York City Police Officer Michael Ackermann is convicted of falsifying record to justify arrest of photographer Robert Stolarik, who was on assignment in Bronx for The New York Times in 2012; prosecutors had rejected Ackermann's defense, contending his actions had interfered with freedom of the press; Ackermann faces up to four years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Officer Michael Ackermann said a photographer on assignment for The New York Times had interfered with an arrest by discharging his camera’s flash in his face, but he did not, in fact, own a flash.

headline.main: New York Police Officer Is Convicted of Lying About Photographer’s Arrest
